data.data: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite complaint investigation [CHL23C855H] completed on January 5, 2024, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, LP.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance  with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999.  Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite complaint investigation [CHL23C855H] completed on January 5, 2024, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, LP.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance  with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999.  Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on October 27,2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Lp, which included NALU Implant Device for Peripheral Nerve Stimulation . Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on October 27,2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Lp, which included NALU Implant Device for Peripheral Nerve Stimulation . Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on October 13, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp, which included  Vertiflex procedure and equipment.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on October 13, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp, which included  Vertiflex procedure and equipment.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on October 11, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp, which included new service for the Rezum procedure.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on October 11, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp, which included new service for the Rezum procedure.  Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced revisit survey conducted on April 18, 2023 following a State Licensure survey completed on January 26, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced revisit survey conducted on April 18, 2023 following a State Licensure survey completed on January 26, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of a full Medicare Recertification survey conducted on January 26, 2023 at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp.  It was determined that the facility was in substantial compliance with the requirements of 42 CFR, Title 42, Part 416 - Conditions for Coverage for Ambulatory Surgical Centers.  Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a full Medicare Recertification survey conducted on January 26, 2023 at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center, Lp.  It was determined that the facility was in substantial compliance with the requirements of 42 CFR, Title 42, Part 416 - Conditions for Coverage for Ambulatory Surgical Centers.  Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a State licensure survey conducted on January 26, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Lp.  It was determined the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999.  Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a State licensure survey conducted on January 26, 2023, at Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Lp.  It was determined the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999.  Plan of Correction: 416.44(a)(1) STANDARD PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT:The ASC must provide a functional and sanitary environment for the provision of surgical services.  Each operating room must be designed and equipped so that the types of surgery conducted can be performed in a manner that protects the lives and assures the physical safety of all individuals in the area.Observations:Based on review of facility policy, medical record review (MR), and staff interview (EMP), it was determined that the facility failed to ensure that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery for three of the twenty medical records reviewed MR7, MR11, and MR16.Findings include: Review of policy "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" last reviewed 1/2023, the policy states "The anesthesia apparatus checkout recommendations will be in each anesthesia machine. Each anesthesia machine will be checked prior to every case of the day. Documentation of the checkout will be completed.  ..."A review conducted on January 26, 2023, of the Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Anesthesia Record for MR7, MR11 and MR16 revealed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery. An interview conducted January 26, 2023, at approximately 10:30 AM with EMP1 confirmed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked for MR7, MR11, and MR16. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/28/2023The deficiencies were reviewed by the Administrator, Medical Director, and the Clinical Director to address the identified deficiency.The Administrator, Medical Director and the Clinical Director reviewed the policy.The Medical Director will:Review policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care"Provide policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's for review.Educate all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's that on the Anesthesia Record, the Pre-Op Checklist:   Anesthesia Machine Patient Identified Pre-Op condition assessed ConsentsMust all be checked and documented for each and every patient.Provide documentation that the education was provided to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's.Seven charts will be audited each week during the monthly medical chart audit.If any or all parts of the Pre-Op Checklist are found to not be documented, the Medical Director will follow-up with the individual(s) and provide:Documentation of the conversations with the individual(s) regarding the undocumented information of Pre-Op Checklist :Anesthesia Machine Patient Identified Pre-Op condition assessed ConsentsDocumentation that education/training was provided and that the expectation is that all documentation of the Pre-Op Checklist is to be completed each and every time.The Clinical Director will:Update the monthly medical record chart audit tool to include the Pre-Op Checklist: Anesthesia Machine Patient Identified Pre-Op condition assessed ConsentsCompleted 1/30/23Report monthly Medical Record Review results to the Medical Director for the next 3 months for follow-up and additional education.Results of the audits will be reviewed/reported to the QAPI committee.  Then surmised and reviewed with MEC/GB Quarterly. 416.44(a)(1) STANDARD PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT: The ASC must provide a functional and sanitary environment for the provision of surgical services.  Each operating room must be designed and equipped so that the types of surgery conducted can be performed in a manner that protects the lives and assures the physical safety of all individuals in the area. Observations:Based on review of facility policy, medical record review (MR), and staff interview (EMP), it was determined that the facility failed to ensure that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery for three of the twenty medical records reviewed MR7, MR11, and MR16.Findings include: Review of policy "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" last reviewed 1/2023, the policy states "The anesthesia apparatus checkout recommendations will be in each anesthesia machine. Each anesthesia machine will be checked prior to every case of the day. Documentation of the checkout will be completed.  ..."A review conducted on January 26, 2023, of the Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Anesthesia Record for MR7, MR11 and MR16 revealed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery. An interview conducted January 26, 2023, at approximately 10:30 AM with EMP1 confirmed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked for MR7, MR11, and MR16. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/28/2023The deficiencies were reviewed by the Administrator, Medical Director, and the Clinical Director to address the identified deficiency.The Administrator, Medical Director and the Clinical Director reviewed the policy.The Medical Director will:Review policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care"Provide policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's for review.Educate all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's that on the Anesthesia Record, the Pre-Op Checklist:   Anesthesia Machine Patient Identified Pre-Op condition assessed ConsentsMust all be checked and documented for each and every patient.Provide documentation that the education was provided to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's.Seven charts will be audited each week during the monthly medical chart audit.If any or all parts of the Pre-Op Checklist are found to not be documented, the Medical Director will follow-up with the individual(s) and provide:Documentation of the conversations with the individual(s) regarding the undocumented information of Pre-Op Checklist :Anesthesia Machine Patient Identified Pre-Op condition assessed ConsentsDocumentation that education/training was provided and that the expectation is that all documentation of the Pre-Op Checklist is to be completed each and every time.The Clinical Director will:Update the monthly medical record chart audit tool to include the Pre-Op Checklist: Anesthesia Machine Patient Identified Pre-Op condition assessed ConsentsCompleted 1/30/23Report monthly Medical Record Review results to the Medical Director for the next 3 months for follow-up and additional education.Results of the audits will be reviewed/reported to the QAPI committee.  Then surmised and reviewed with MEC/GB Quarterly. 555.33 (d)(3) LICENSURE Anesthesia Policies and Procedures:555.33  Anesthesia policies and procedures 	(d) Anesthesia procedures shall provide at least the following:		(3) Prior to beginning the administration of anesthesia, the anesthetist shall check equipment to be used in administration of anesthetic agents. An anesthetic gas machine in anesthetising areas shall have a pin-index system.Observations:Based on review of facility policy, medical record review (MR), and staff interview (EMP), it was determined that the facility failed to ensure that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery for three of the twenty medical records reviewed MR7, MR11, and MR16.Findings include: Review of policy "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" last reviewed 1/2023, the policy states "The anesthesia apparatus checkout recommendations will be in each anesthesia machine. Each anesthesia machine will be checked prior to every case of the day. Documentation of the checkout will be completed.  ..."A review conducted on January 26, 2023, of the Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Anesthesia Record for MR7, MR11 and MR16 revealed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery. An interview conducted January 26, 2023, at approximately 10:30 AM with EMP1 confirmed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked for MR7, MR11, and MR16. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/28/2023The deficiencies were reviewed by the Administrator, Medical Director, and the Clinical Director to address the identified deficiency.The Administrator, Medical Director and the Clinical Director reviewed the policy.The Medical Director will:Review policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care"Provide policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's for review.Educate all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's that on the Anesthesia Record, the Pre-Op Checklist:Anesthesia MachinePatient IdentifiedPre-Op condition assessedConsentsMust all be checked and documented for each and every patient.Provide documentation that the education was provided to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's.Seven charts will be audited each week during the monthly medical chart audit.If any or all parts of the Pre-Op Checklist are found to not be documented, the Medical Director will follow-up with the individual(s) and provide:Documentation of the conversations with the individual(s) regarding the undocumented information of Pre-Op Checklist :Anesthesia MachinePatient IdentifiedPre-Op condition assessedConsentsDocumentation that education/training was provided and that the expectation is that all documentation of the Pre-Op Checklist is to be completed each and every time.The Clinical Director will:Update the monthly medical record chart audit tool to include the Pre-Op Checklist:Anesthesia MachinePatient IdentifiedPre-Op condition assessedConsentsCompleted 1/30/23Report monthly Medical Record Review results to the Medical Director for the next 3 months for follow-up and additional education.Results of the audits will be reviewed/reported to the QAPI committee. Then surmised and reviewed with MEC/GB Quarterly. 555.33 (d)(3) LICENSURE Anesthesia Policies and Procedures: 555.33  Anesthesia policies and procedures 	(d) Anesthesia procedures shall provide at least the following:		(3) Prior to beginning the administration of anesthesia, the anesthetist shall check equipment to be used in administration of anesthetic agents. An anesthetic gas machine in anesthetising areas shall have a pin-index system. Observations:Based on review of facility policy, medical record review (MR), and staff interview (EMP), it was determined that the facility failed to ensure that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery for three of the twenty medical records reviewed MR7, MR11, and MR16.Findings include: Review of policy "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" last reviewed 1/2023, the policy states "The anesthesia apparatus checkout recommendations will be in each anesthesia machine. Each anesthesia machine will be checked prior to every case of the day. Documentation of the checkout will be completed.  ..."A review conducted on January 26, 2023, of the Hershey Outpatient Surgery Center Anesthesia Record for MR7, MR11 and MR16 revealed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked prior to each surgery. An interview conducted January 26, 2023, at approximately 10:30 AM with EMP1 confirmed there was no documentation that the anesthesia equipment was checked for MR7, MR11, and MR16. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/28/2023The deficiencies were reviewed by the Administrator, Medical Director, and the Clinical Director to address the identified deficiency.The Administrator, Medical Director and the Clinical Director reviewed the policy.The Medical Director will:Review policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care"Provide policy ANES 545 "Anesthesia Apparatus Check and Care" to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's for review.Educate all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's that on the Anesthesia Record, the Pre-Op Checklist:Anesthesia MachinePatient IdentifiedPre-Op condition assessedConsentsMust all be checked and documented for each and every patient.Provide documentation that the education was provided to all credentialed Anesthesiologist and CRNA's.Seven charts will be audited each week during the monthly medical chart audit.If any or all parts of the Pre-Op Checklist are found to not be documented, the Medical Director will follow-up with the individual(s) and provide:Documentation of the conversations with the individual(s) regarding the undocumented information of Pre-Op Checklist :Anesthesia MachinePatient IdentifiedPre-Op condition assessedConsentsDocumentation that education/training was provided and that the expectation is that all documentation of the Pre-Op Checklist is to be completed each and every time.The Clinical Director will:Update the monthly medical record chart audit tool to include the Pre-Op Checklist:Anesthesia MachinePatient IdentifiedPre-Op condition assessedConsentsCompleted 1/30/23Report monthly Medical Record Review results to the Medical Director for the next 3 months for follow-up and additional education.Results of the audits will be reviewed/reported to the QAPI committee. Then surmised and reviewed with MEC/GB Quarterly.
